meanings.definition: Resembling a small crescent or moon.
meanings.sent1: The lunular shape of the earrings made them look like tiny moons.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a lunular pattern on the wall, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The lunular banana slice in the fruit salad seemed to wink at me playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed a lunular curve, brightening up the room like a crescent moon.
meanings.sent5: The lunular glow of the nightlight provided a soft, comforting light in the dark room.

meanings.definition: A small, crescent-shaped object or mark.
meanings.sent1: She found a shiny lunular on the beach, a treasure from the sea.
meanings.sent2: The lunular on the document indicated the beginning of a new section.
meanings.sent3: The chef garnished the dish with a lunular of lemon peel, adding a hint of citrus.
meanings.sent4: The moon left a lunular reflection on the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist discovered a lunular artifact, a piece of ancient jewelry.
